definitions.definition: to move or turn around a central fixed point; to make something do this

examples.text: Stay well away from the helicopter when its blades start to rotate.
winds rotating around the eye of a hurricane
Make sure that the propellor can rotate freely.
Once the starter motor is rotating, you should be able to get the car going.
The blades of the fan rotated rapidly above her.
The earth takes 24 hours to rotate on its axis.

definitions.definition: if a job rotates, or if people rotate a job, they regularly change the job or regularly change who does the job

examples.text: The EU presidency rotates among the members.
When I joined the company, I rotated around the different sections.
We rotate the night shift so no one has to do it all the time.

wordOrigin: late 17th cent.: from Latin rotat- ‘turned in a circle’, from the verb rotare, from rota ‘wheel’.
